So if we want to reduce traffic, we must look to affordable alternatives to transportation, and my BUS Act will do just that.

For every bus on the road, we can remove up to 60 cars during rush hour! That's a lot of cars! And as someone who has commuted using the bus from Sugarloaf to downtown, I can tell you it's a lot less stressful too!
Bus Rapid Transit is significantly cheaper than building light rail transit, can be completed faster, can use electric buses to cut emissions, and will move more people than a highway expansion.

Right now our mechanisms for federal funding transportation are basically light rail, rail, or highways with not a lot of room maneuvering. That's why my first #FutureFit bill will expand Bus Rapid Transit (BRT). Aptly named the BUS Act.
